text: Can. Not a damn thing wrong with this, for the style. Bready, lively carbonation, sweet grains. Great alternative to BMC.

Can poured a clear gold with a small lasting white head. Aromas of bread, yeast, fruitiness and a hint of floral notes. Palate was medium bodied and crisp with a dry finish. Flavors of bread, citrus and light yeast with a crisp dry finish.
Can. Lemon, lactic acid, biscuit malt, and straw aroma. Golden yellow with giant white head. Sweet tangy lemon, milky biscuit malt, and mildly bitter straw flavor. Good body. Tasty citrusy lager.
Sample at GABF 2016.Low fluffy and quickly disappearing white head. Clear yellow golden body. Weak malt aroma and flavor with little hops bitterness, low carbonation and a short finish.

Can:
Lightly hazy, yellow-gold with a foamy white head.
Lemon, yeast, grain aroma.
Taste is slightly sour grain malt, lemon juice....grass and peel bitter.
Very citric and acidic...and quite a bit of farmhouse feel to it....
different for a pale lager, but quite enjoyable.

Tap at JL Beers Bismarck Im pretty hungover after trying to have fun in this town so easing into travel day with a pale lager. Pours gold light nose of straw and pepper. Tastes the same light lemon as well. Served very cold and its crisp not bad for style. N
Hazy straw/gold color; Light to medium body; Aroma of hay, floral, and light hops; Flavor of slight sweet malt, cereal/grain, and some hops; Crisp finish; Decent lager.

Tap pour from a pitcher at Spicy Pie in downtown Fargo. Plastic pint glass. Golden with some orange and reddish undertones. Aroma is definitely a lager with malty characteristics. Taste is also slightly malty with a hint of hops. Trying to be low key and thats what Im getting. Easy to consume but not all that enjoyable. Feels like a cheap beer. You can find better.

On draft. Pale gold in colour with medium carbonation. Mild but pleasant aromas of grainy malts and wild grass. Flavors are of pilsner malt, white toast, and a bit of herbal hop. Light bodied with a balanced bitterness. Im typically quite dismissive of this style, but this was actually some clean and well balanced stuff. Surprisingly good.
Draft at Sioux Falls festival. Crystal clear yellow color, fluffy white head. Aroma of black pepper and straw. Taste is dusty, peppery straw. Decent.

Sampled at GABF 2015, In the sample glass clear yellow with white foam the lasted. Nose of light malts with grassy and citrus hops, and light fruit. Light body and a very smooth and clean mouth feel. The flavor is a lot of light citrus hops, and the finish is lightly bitter and dry, Very nice drinking beer.
